name: Abereiddy (Blue Lagoon)
description: The iconic Blue Lagoon is a former slate quarry with deep water, perfect for jumps. A must-do coasteering classic.

name: St Davids (St Non's)
description: Wilder coastline south of St Davids. Caves, arches, and wildlife encounters are common here.

name: Stackpole Quay
description: Sheltered south coast spot with caves and clear water. Great for families and beginners. Near Barafundle Bay.

name: Abermawr
description: Rugged north coast. Remote feel with larger swell potential and dramatic rock formations.

name: Porthclais Harbour
description: Sheltered harbour providing a safe introduction to coasteering. Good for windy days when other spots are blown out.

name: Lydstep Caverns
description: Famous for its smugglers caves which are accessible at low tide. A unique spelunking-style coasteer.

name: Rhossili (Worm's Head)
description: The Dragon's back. A committing adventure around the tidal island of Worm's Head. Expert guidance essential.

name: Caswell Bay
description: Accessible and popular. Good for younger groups and beginners looking for a gentle introduction.

name: Mewslade Bay
description: Dramatic limestone cliffs and jagged rocks. A stunning location for those willing to walk a bit.

name: South Stack
description: Beneath the famous lighthouse. Big jumps, deep water, and seals. A high-adrenaline location.

name: Porth Dafarch
description: Sheltered cove often used for training. Rocky outcrops and easy access make it perfect for skill building.

name: Trearddur Bay
description: Very accessible urban coasteering. Good for quick sessions and large groups.

name: Rhoscolyn (Bwa Gwyn)
description: Features the White Arch (Bwa Gwyn). Stunning geology and wilder feel than Trearddur.

name: Morfa Nefyn
description: Coasteering near the famous Ty Coch Inn. Gentle waters and sandy bays interspersed with rocks.

name: Aberdaron
description: The end of the road. Wild and beautiful with views towards Bardsey Island. Clear water.

name: Barry Island
description: Urban coasteering near Cardiff. Great for stag/hen dos but lacks the clarity and scenery of the west.
